revised_title: Observations of the Total Solar Eclipse of 1901 May 18 at Pamplemousses, Mauritius
tldr: During the total solar eclipse of May 18, 1901, in Mauritius, (Mrs.) A. S. D. Maunder and her team made various observations and captured photographs of the solar corona and prominences using different instruments and techniques. The observations revealed details of the corona, polar rays, and extensions, providing valuable data for further study of solar phenomena.
